races.name: Nord
races.description: The native people of Skyrim, hardy warriors with resistance to cold

racial_power.name: Battle Cry
racial_power.effect: Once per session, cause enemies within zone to flee for one round

optional_extras.name: Voice of the Nord (Thu'um)
optional_extras.description: Access to the ancient Nordic tradition of the Thu'um (Dragon Shouts). See data/rules/thuum_system.json for complete mechanics.
optional_extras.benefit: Can learn and use Dragon Shouts. Choose ONE shout at character creation from: Unrelenting Force, Whirlwind Sprint, or Kyne's Peace. You know ONE word of this shout and start with 2/8 segments on its mastery clock.
optional_extras.lore: The Voice is an ancient Nordic tradition passed down through generations. While rare, some Nords still learn fragments of this power from elders or discover it through heritage.
optional_extras.mechanical_notes: Uses Fate Point initially, mastery clock reduces to once per scene. See thuum_system.json for full details.

races.name: Imperial
races.description: Cosmopolitan humans from Cyrodiil, skilled diplomats and traders
races.appearance: Mediterranean features, olive to light skin

racial_ability.name: Voice of the Emperor
racial_ability.effect: Once per session, automatically succeed at a Rapport roll to calm NPCs or avert a violent escalation.

optional_extras.name: Way of the Voice (Thu'um - Advanced Study)
optional_extras.description: Through disciplined study and dedication, you've gained access to the Thu'um. Imperials learn through structured training rather than heritage.
optional_extras.benefit: Can learn and use Dragon Shouts through gameplay. Cannot choose shout at character creation - must learn through Greybeard training, Word Walls, or meditation. Mastery clocks have 10 segments instead of 8.
optional_extras.lore: While Thu'um is a Nordic tradition, disciplined Imperials can learn it through rigorous study, particularly from the Greybeards who respect dedication over heritage.
optional_extras.mechanical_notes: Slower mastery (+2 segments) but gain +1 segment when training with masters due to disciplined approach. See thuum_system.json for full details.

races.name: Breton
races.description: Human-elf hybrids from High Rock with natural magic resistance

racial_power.name: Dragonskin
racial_power.effect: Once per session, absorb 50% of magic directed at you for one scene

optional_extras.name: Scholarly Voice (Thu'um - Magical Study)
optional_extras.description: Your magical aptitude allows you to understand Thu'um as a form of magic-adjacent power. You approach the Voice through academic study.
optional_extras.benefit: Can learn and use Dragon Shouts through gameplay. Cannot choose shout at character creation - must learn through study, Word Walls, or meditation. Mastery clocks have 10 segments. +1 difficulty on learning from Word Walls, but +2 to learning from texts/scrolls due to scholarly nature.
optional_extras.lore: Bretons, with their mixed heritage and natural magical talent, can understand Thu'um as a linguistic magic rather than purely spiritual power.
optional_extras.mechanical_notes: Slower mastery but excels at book learning. See thuum_system.json for full details.

races.name: Redguard
races.description: Dark-skinned humans from Hammerfell, master swordsmen

racial_power.name: Adrenaline Rush
racial_power.effect: Once per session, gain +2 to all physical actions for one scene

races.name: High Elf (Altmer)
races.description: Tall elves from Summerset Isle, naturally gifted with magic

racial_ability.name: Highborn
racial_ability.effect: Once per session, regenerate all magicka instantly

races.social_note: High Elves face prejudice in Skyrim due to Thalmor

races.name: Wood Elf (Bosmer)
races.description: Small elves from Valenwood, expert hunters and archers

racial_power.name: Command Animal
racial_power.effect: Once per session, make animals fight for you for one scene

cultural_traits: Green Pact (carnivorous diet, no harming plants in Valenwood)

races.name: Dark Elf (Dunmer)
races.description: Gray-skinned elves from Morrowind, refugees in Skyrim
races.appearance: Gray or blue skin, red eyes

racial_power.name: Ancestor's Wrath
racial_power.effect: Once per session, cloak yourself in fire that damages adjacent enemies for one scene

racial_ability.name: Berserker Rage
racial_ability.effect: Once per session, gain +3 to all physical attacks for two rounds, but take +1 stress from attacks

races.name: Khajiit
races.description: Cat-like people from Elsweyr, traders and thieves

racial_ability.name: Night Eye
racial_ability.effect: Can see perfectly in darkness, no penalties for low light

races.social_note: Khajiit are not allowed in cities due to prejudice

races.name: Argonian
races.description: Reptilian people from Black Marsh, adapted to water

racial_ability.name: Resist Disease
racial_ability.effect: +2 to resist disease and poison, can breathe underwater

racial_power.name: Histskin
racial_power.effect: Once per session, rapidly regenerate health (clear all stress boxes)

racial_notes.discrimination: Certain races face prejudice in Skyrim (especially Khajiit, Argonians, Dark Elves, High Elves)
racial_notes.starting_equipment: All races start with same basic equipment options
racial_notes.cultural_roleplay: Players should consider cultural background in character decisions
